Reviews.Title: Not a good computer
Reviews.Author: Gen
Reviews.Content: I'm actually returning this netbook (or laptop, whatever you want to call it) because it is horrible. I'm a fast typer and this computer cannot keep up with my typing speed. The mouse tracker is unstable and unable to understand when I want to move the mouse or moves on its own, which messes up my typing. It constantly cannot connect to my Wi-Fi (maybe because it's very protected, but I've never had a problem with that on any other computers). Forget even trying to load a video on this. The only positive I have about it was when I could get a video to load, the sound was good. Other than that, I'm very glad I'm still in the window of time to be able to return this.

Reviews.Title: Sent this item back
Reviews.Author: Captain Jack
Reviews.Content: Seller was great but item was junk.  I work with software and computers and bought this for my wife as an alternate computer when she is just surfing the net or reading emails and found the mouse to be terrible and the entire system slow.  Seller provided RMA and I returned it and bought my wife a tablet instead and now she is in heaven and doesn't have to lug her laptop around from upstairs to downstairs.

Reviews.Title: Asus 1015E-DS01 is upgradable
Reviews.Author: ,Ryota Hamaie
Reviews.Content: I bought a refurbished Asus 1015E-DS01. It was $149. When I first opened this lap top, it was not bad for this price( I mean $149 not over $200).  I think this is the cheapest 64bid Windows 8 machine. Intel celeron chip produces a lot of heat, so you do not want to put on your lap directly. I was frustrated with the touch-pad so I used a USB mouse. Because my all PCs are SSD installed, I could not stand this slow speed of this laptop. It took 30 minutes to decide to change a SATA drive to a SSD. First, I unscrewed 4 small screws and unlocked keyboard, then I unscrewed total 14 screws from the panel. There was a yellow sticker on one of the screws. If you removed it, you would loose manufacture warranty. Well, I paid only $149, so even if I broke this, I could sell parts and I would loose probable $30 after all. Who cares? Anyway, I decided to break the seal. After that it was easy. Removed cables and changed to a Kingston 64GB SSD. By the way, I already cloned the hard drive image to the SSD by using Acronis true-image 2013. After I upgraded to SSD, I checked windows experience Index. Primary hard drive index was now 6.8. I did not upgraded a memory because I did not have an extra memory for this. Now may Asus boots much faster than before. I am not sure this would extend the battery life or not. Again, if you want to upgrade, you can do it on your own risk. It is not difficult.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Laptop
Reviews.Author: AM/PM For Less
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical to buy a mini laptop like this because I was afraid it wasn't going to be powerful.  Boy, was I wrong!!  This little thing does everything a normal sized laptop would do, and then some!!!The only thing I don't like is the Windows 8.  It is a little confusing.  It may just take awhile to get used to.  However, I do like the option that I can have some things that I use more than other right there on the start screen as little app icons.Overall, I love my new laptop.  Thanks, Asus!! :)

Reviews.Title: Heat Issue
Reviews.Author: E. Dell "Factotum"
Reviews.Content: ...great design and highly responsive...right size and style for my applications...however...unit I received and returned consistently heated up to the point of being hot...had to wait almost a half hour before putting into my bag...possibly time for me to look carefully at tablets...

Reviews.Title: Nice Notebook
Reviews.Author: gnrlyspking
Reviews.Content: I've had this a few months now.  No complaints.  It is stable and lives up to the specs.  I use it as a notebook, watch movies, read on it, and as a "laptop".  Oh and to connect to my NAS and listen to music.  It's very convenient and reliable.

Reviews.Title: Good for basics on long foreign trip
Reviews.Author: jd
Reviews.Content: Got the Asus 1015e for a long trip all over the South Pacific (3 countries). Did not want to bring my MacBook Pro as I didn't really need it & I needed to keep my carry on bag's weight down (was loaded with camera gear). IPad was not an option as I needed to have something to back up my pictures on. And I wanted a keyboard for email, changing/ making travel reservations during the trip. I did lots of research on this Asus. Reviews seemed pretty good for what it is and what it is intended for. So I ordered this, it came the next day and was satisified right away. It started up quick and connected to my WiFi right away. AC/Batt charger is small & that helps. Screen is a matte screen (what I wanted) and decent. I downloaded Firefox and MalwareBytes right away. Took a little while getting used to the screen size, but got used to it. I did get a small mouse for this and it is much easier to use a mouse than the mousepad. So I highly recommend getting a mouse for this Asus. Unit fit in my Lowe Trekker backpack just fine. On this trip I also took an IPod Touch for WiFi backup. I also got a protective sleeve for this, going for  12 inch sleeve which leaves a little wiggle room. The 10 inch sleeves I looked at were a little tight because of the rear battery bump. Battery life has been good so far and YouTube videos ran OK. I did not do any intensive photo editing work on this, just back up of pix. I had no problem connecting to WiFi in either Australia, New Zealand or Tahiti with this unit. One thing to consider, when going on big trips, make sure you know/have all you passwords and pin numbers with you. This is just in case Google, MSN or Yahoo questions you about logging in from a foreign location & or computer. So I do recommend this as a lightweight basic netbook, perfectly good for email, internet, Facebook and picture back up storage. And so far, no issues depsite lots of bumps and travel. I did try to be gentle with it as it is a plastic case. I have not yet, but probably will get a small/slim DVD player/burner for this

Reviews.Title: Most Powerful Netbook Out There but Plagued by Connection Issues
Reviews.Author: Matthew Garvin
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: After several months of use I am downgrading my review to 2 stars.  I am an advanced user (in IT professionally) and this little powerhouse is plagued by connection issues.  Wifi goes down frequently in many different environments, even while other devices connect without issue.Here is my original review:I am a big believer in Netbooks.  This is the 6th or 7th one I owned.  I started with a Dell Mini 9.  Contrary to popular belief, you *can* get plenty of work done on them, if you clean them up, put in the max RAM allowed, and don't have unrealistic expectations.  It is sad that this market is diminishing, but I am relieved at least -- contrary to what was reported -- netbooks are still being made.Pros for this Netbook:- super small size- ships with 2 gigs of RAM- fast processor- USB 3.0- HDMI out and VGA out- hi res for a small screenCons- ships with Win8- very clunky feel, almost like it is a solid plastic brick- does not feel as snappy as I expectedI have had this netbook for 3 days, ordered from Amazon.  First thing I have done is remove Asus bloatware, installed Windows updates, and installed Classic Shell to get back the start button and flyout navigation like XP had.I will update this review as I get more experience with the netbook.  But out of the gate, it does not feel as snappy as I expected considering the 2 gigs of RAM and processor.  And the chassis really does feel like a solid piece of cheap plastic.  The Acer 270D I bought last year -- although also plastic -- has a much better, metallic feel to it.  I am giving this netbook 3 stars so far, although I am confident I can eliminate unneeded apps and processes and get it up to speed as I have previous netbooks.

Reviews.Title: has some serious flaws
Reviews.Author: hurtstotalktoyou
Reviews.Content: Although there are a lot of great things about this netbook, it has some serious flaws.  After a month of pure headaches and hair-pulling, I returned mine.  (Thank goodness for amazon's awesome return policy!)Problem #1:  Horrible touchpad.  As other reviewers have noted, the touchpad is simply atrocious.  It is ridiculously over-sensitive and seriously interferes with typing, to the point of making it almost impossible to get any significant word processing accomplished.  Furthermore, it doesn't have proper buttons, but instead the "buttons" are part of the touchpad itself.  The right-click function never even worked on mine (at least, not in Windows).  The basic pointer function is pretty awful too, worse than any of the other notebooks I've owned.  It doesn't have a scroll tab either, and despite hours of technical support I was unable to disable tapping.  Really, this is an over-the-top ridiculous problem.  It would have been better if the unit had no touchpad at all.  I had to use an external mouse anyway, and the pad continually interferes with typing.Problem #2:  Bug makes it impossible to perform factory reset.  On netbooks (and on all PCs) it is common to ship with a factory reset partition instead of recovery CD/DVD media.  With every other PC I've owned, as long as you keep that recovery partition intact then you can perform a factory reset.  Well, not with this netbook!  I never touched the recovery partition, or any of the Windows partitions either.  But the unit ships with a storage-only NTFS partition onto which I installed linux.  I'm not sure exactly what the problem was, but when I attempted to perform a factory reset (because I was trying to fix the touchpad issues, see problem #1 above) I discovered that it was now impossible, despite the fact that both the Windows and the recovery partitions were completely untouched.  When I contacted ASUS tech support, they told me I would have to physically mail in the unit to get it reset.  (Instead I just returned it to amazon for a refund.)Problem #3:  Subpar battery life.  This one I knew before I bought it, but it's still irritating.  It is well-known that the Atom D2700 performs similarly to the Celeron 847, but the former has much better battery life.  This is probably true for other Atom processors like the D2550.  I know that my old Atom N270 system gets better battery life.  Since this netbook doesn't have more than 2GB memory, nor any other worthwhile feature not supported by the Atom line, it doesn't make sense to me to insist on the Celeron.  If I buy another netbook any time soon, I'll try to get an Atom.Problem #4:  Limited linux compatibility.  The hardware does not support the latest ubuntu-variant releases.  Instead I had to downgrade to xubuntu 12.04, and even then the grub2 bootloader never worked correctly.  (This is due to the UEFI alternative to BIOS.)  This problem hit me totally out of left field, since Asus has a history of making linux-friendly products.  In fact, they offer this very netbook to ship with ubuntu instead of windows!  So I was very upset to learn that the windows version doesn't play well with linux, since I do most of my work in linux and only need Windows for specialized tasks.Somebody before me said that "you get what you pay for."  But it doesn't take money to fix these issues.  There are plenty of netbooks out there at the same price point but which have MUCH better design.  Asus has simply dropped the ball here.  Big time.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Jesse-Douglas Mathewson "desktopia"
Reviews.Content: Pros*Compact, lightweight*Matte screen*Probably won't find a better Windows laptop in this price rangeCons*Trackpad is absolutely atrocious*Battery life not up to snuff in desktop mode*Power cable will not stay in jack*Windows 8 is as pretty as it is useless*Cannot upgrade RAMI have been satisfied with my purchase, given what I paid for: not blown away, not underwhelmed, just satisfied. I love the form factor of this laptop--my previous Acer 11" netbook was always just a bit too big. Unlike my first Asus eeePC, I don't sacrifice any resolution on this display. Plus, the matte texture reduces glare and prevents smudging.There are some problems however. The trackpad is *by far* the worst I have ever used. It is incredibly sensitive in some cases and doesn't detect taps in others. I recommend turning off most of the gestures on the included trackpad software. The battery life is great when you're in Metro/Modern, but in Desktop mode it drains pretty fast--I rarely get more than 3:00 out of it even with the display at 25%. And that's a problem, because Window 8 is as pretty as it is useless. I find myself spending absolutely zero time in the Modern environment. Moreover, the power cable slips out of the jack rather haphazardly, which is annoying. Finally, as the other reviews note, this is not upgradeable.The cons are annoying, but given the cost I don't think they detract from this product too much. I've found it much more useable than my previous netbooks. Hopefully it will last as long as my first eeePC, and much longer than my Acer.

Reviews.Title: Garbage! Windows 8 is BEYOND terrible. REALLY nice paperweight!
Reviews.Author: S
Reviews.Content: +Nice Hardware+Nice Paperweight-Windows 8 basically bricks your laptop from the getgoGarbage! Advise purchasing one with windows 7 preloaded.

Reviews.Title: Handy Notebook
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: I love this handy notebook. I can bring it anywhere for work if needed. It works pretty ok and so far it hasn't failed me yet. The processor is fast in my standards since all I do with this is word processing and occasional surfing over the internet.

Reviews.Title: So bad a laptop
Reviews.Author: Weikun W.
Reviews.Content: CPU goes to 90% very often when open multiple websites at the same time. Easily 99%, 100% if open a large PDF file in your browser.Now after 9 months, two of three USB connectors don't work. Luckily I can still use the one in the left side.Remark: You can't expect too much from a $270 laptop.

Reviews.Title: Very touchy
Reviews.Author: Linda S Porter
Reviews.Content: It comes with Windows 8.0 and I generally like it a lot. However, it is so TOUCHY. If you don't do everything just right, it whisks you off to another site, which diminishes some of the enjoyment of being online. The 8.0 is not big deal.....easy to get accustomed to; it does not come with any form of word processing software. No Microsoft office, etc........they told me I could use Wordpad, but my grandson installed something better.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy as well as Great Overall System
Reviews.Author: Robert Koons "ROb"
Reviews.Content: If you do buy this machine just be sure you do all the updates prior to using otherwise you will get frustrated.  Once updates are complete including Wi does 8.1 you will have a powerhouse system in a netbook size package.  I am adding a wireless mouse along with a wireless keyboard just for when I need to do some serious work.  I use this for not only work but also to watch movies and videos on b in screen along with a ton of other everyday uses.  It is now my go to computer and may end up with another one soon but if I get another I will buy the touchscreen probably just because of what I will use it for.  Great Great Great!

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your time
Reviews.Author: Robert T Simpson
Reviews.Content: The computer was perfect from size and weight as well as speed and storage but windows 8 key didn't activate and amazon service could only refer back to ASUS support. ASUS support although far better at the customer service could not help because the S/N had been removed and reset which should have used the microsoft window 8 key on the mother board only returned incorrect key buy another. The circle ends after large circle motion right back at amazon which will result in another customer buying and "what is that Johnny Cash song oh yes, May the circle be unbroken."

Reviews.Title: Midget computer from hell
Reviews.Author: Reed Jacob
Reviews.Content: It was so slow, right out of the box. It came with windows 8 and kept stalling, so I put windows 7 on it. It handled that better until last week when it started beeping furiously and gave me the blue screen of death. Now it won't even boot up. Don't purchase this laptop. Save yourself a lot of effort and mental anguish.

Reviews.Title: To flimsey.
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer in may 2013. It has now fell apart. I had problems with the keyboard , now the power charger stopped working.

Reviews.Title: Terrible purchase. Not happy at all.
Reviews.Author: Jessica Cambo
Reviews.Content: Pros:- Very compact / lightweight.- Fair battery life.Cons:- Windows 8. Even if I liked Windows 8 in the first place, this computer has VERY little processing power and isn't meant to run such a graphic and heavy OS, therefore it is quite laggy and sometimes has trouble with the most menial of tasks.- BAD TOUCHPAD. CANNOT STRESS THIS ENOUGH. Of course a netbook will have a tiny touchpad, which is fine, but this particular one has THREE DEAD SPACES. Three places where touch is not acknowledged AT ALL.You can't expect much from a $200 netbook and I'm fine with that, all I needed it for was some light web browsing and note-taking for class. Both impossible. Do NOT recommend.

Reviews.Title: says very good
Reviews.Author: Alan Watkins
Reviews.Content: Got this for my daughter so I have not or do not use this item, but she said it is great just what she wanted.

Reviews.Title: windows 8
Reviews.Author: Brian Hickman
Reviews.Content: I ended up liking windows 8.  but the hard drive failed after the first couple of reboots.  but it was a refurbished unit.  it was slower then I expected even with doing the speed up tips mentioned in some of the other reviews.

Reviews.Title: The touchpad isn't great. It doesn't always respond
Reviews.Author: Rachel Duncan
Reviews.Content: This computer serves it's purpose. The touchpad isn't great. It doesn't always respond, and I still can't get it to scroll. The battery life is decent - about five hours. In all the computer is quite slow, but it's very portable and that's what I was looking for. I only use it for writing and a little web browsing, and it does just fine for that. Could be better, could be worse. I'm fairly happy with it for the price though.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this piece of junk
Reviews.Author: R
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a spare, in case my regular computer fails. But, you know, it needed to work. This didn't: Non-working WiFi, a barely functioning mouse, and a battery that doesn't last anywhere close to the claimed time. Do not buy this computer. Pick another brand.In the second model I received (the first also failed), the WiFi only worked intermittently. I couldn't even use Windows Update, which I tried several times. The mouse was squishy in the corner and felt loose. It was also only occasionally responsive. Finally, the battery ran down to 60% in 45 minutes.In the first model, the mouse was just as bad -- unresponsive touchpad that was loose in the lower left corner. WiFi worked on that one, but the mouse was pretty important.There is a reason this thing is so cheap. You don't want it. Having sent back two, I gave up.

Reviews.Title: asus 10.1- inch laptop
Reviews.Author: Summer_79
Reviews.Content: I've had to two laptops with age on them die within the last couple of months.  I needed a laptop to complete a training assignment for work that my Kindle Fire would not load properly.  I'm having a hard time adjusting to Windows 8, but I blame Windows for a crappy operating system, not ASUS. The touchpad has a little bit of a mind of its own.  You get what you pay for(cheap appearance, some key placement is a little cramped).  This is a decent machine for simple tasks such as Facebook, email, photos, browsing and the web training I must complete for work.

Reviews.Title: Portable, light, and cute.
Reviews.Author: Hannah Anderson "humancow"
Reviews.Content: I bought this so that I could work on school papers and assignments while I was waiting for classes. I needed something that didn't weigh very much. My back was stating to hurt from carrying my laptop around campus. I also didn't need a ton of storage since I would just be editing word documents and sometimes checking school email. So I bought this cute little computer.When it came in the mail I hooked it up right away. It started up VERY QUICKLY. After set up however, it started to run slow. I am a little disappointed with the speed and that word freezes about every 15 minuets.What I do like:-It's super light!-runs quietly-the keyboard is small, but not too small. (I don't hit wrong letters very often.)-the screens light does not make my eyes hurt.-it has a good amount of storage-it downloads videos quickly (when it works)-batterylife is great! The charger is one single cord unlike a normal laptop, so if you do have to plug in it's not a pain.-what's not to love about windows 8? It's extremely easy to use!-small. It is about the size of a spiral notebook. It's thin too. I could probably fit it into my messenger bag if I needed to.Things I hate:-mouse pad is annoying. When I touch it to move it around it brings up the side bar. I catch myself trying to avoid using the mouse altogether.-Internet is VERY SLOW. I will sometimes look up info online with it, but just the homepage takes 5 minuets to load most of the time.-Programs keep crashing. When I open a word document it immediately says "Not responding" and I have to wait for a long time for it to fix its self. This is really frustrating!! I have even tried having only one program open at a time... no difference. In all I really like it! I recommend it to any college students who need something that won't add extra weight to your already heavy backpack. I hope that the problems I am having with the computer can be fixed because if it wasn't for that it would be perfect!

Reviews.Title: Great little netbook once you update to a ssd
Reviews.Author: vito valenti
Reviews.Content: Great little netbook needed something that was small and wouldn't care if i damaged for work.. Installed a 256 ssd 7mm wasn't to hard taking apart after that installed windows 7 32-64 ultimate with the 2gb ram installed memory available was 700-800 meg with reboot if you opened chrome you would be down to 300-400 megs which isn't good.. I then installed windows 8.1 32bit only took 6 mins to install now i get 1.1-1.3gb memory available with chrome opened 800-950 megs.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Ricardo
Reviews.Content: Work's great, fast enough for my own personal use,great quality and great price. Love windows 8.  Asus has been a great reliable product for years.

Reviews.Title: soo Damn close to perfect..
Reviews.Author: Texacano
Reviews.Content: If you could upgrade ram and to SSD drive it would be amazing and I would pay for it.This little guy definitely has WiFi issues I downloaded Microsoft office and it feels like 2003 laptop right before 1gb RAM came out.If they were to make special edition 32 bit for these small books that would solve the speed problem which I'm considering but Obvious future software would be incompatible cause programs get so old and phased out. Great graphics with change from other user recommendations.there are 2 Asus programs you have to keep on one for the hot keys and the other for WiFi.when you notice yiur WiFi doesn't work that's the program you have to reload. If you wanna mess with software be wary I think I prefer factory settings cause its faster.touchy but faster to use.Would I buy again yes because I have a beast for a home computer.GOT 3 year oops protection.this little guy is JUST ENOUGH FOR BASIC operations.

Reviews.Title: Night Player
Reviews.Author: night player
Reviews.Content: Good netbook computer. Have not had any mechanical problems with it. Was delivered as expected. Had not used this brand before but it seems to be very well constructed. The only thing is it does generate a little heat after running for awhile. Not too bad and cools down quickly when shut down. This company installs a lot of stuff that can be removed if you don't need it. After doing that and refreshing the drive to speed up the processing it is a good lite weight on the road computer. Would buy from them again

Reviews.Title: fun machine
Reviews.Author: Robert Reagan
Reviews.Content: This is my second one and I just love this little machine and the things it can do. Great to carry around in your pocket and when you need a pc its there are ready to work . Seems tough to

Reviews.Title: small laptop for $280
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I ordered the unit after considering all tablets.  (my 1025c died and I salvaged the hard disk with a $9 adapter)Windows 8 is diferent.  When confused, move mouse to four corners and find out.  The famous 'start' button is the keyboard 'windows' key.Users complain about 1G and slow with all previous Asus netbook.  Now, this one comes with 2G, >720p display, and hdmi output!  People still complaints.I use it to watch high quality mkv through the hdmi output, and now I have a movie player that play all formats.  Of course, I use it for other things too.***********I changed the rating from five stars to three stars after weeks of using it.  It's running uncomfortablly hot and it's battery lasts half of what previous ASUS netbook was.  The touch pad is frustrated to use at time.

Reviews.Title: Would not recommand it
Reviews.Author: Saieb AlRawi
Reviews.Content: 1. The computer is too slow (maybe due to Windows 8 compatibility).2. Goes into self check every time it is logged in or rebooted taking over an hour to complete.3.The display quality is too poor.4.The mouse pad never functioned properly.

Reviews.Title: Definite fan
Reviews.Author: Meagan Bechel
Reviews.Content: I ordered this when my previous netbook died. I've only had it about a week, but so far it seems to function for what I need it to.Why 4 stars?Well, the mousepad doesn't seem as sensitive as the one on my previous netbook and the computer tends to bog down pretty heavily when it needs to update. When it does update, it takes at least 45 min+, but that's to be expected sometimes.My only other grip was in that removing some of the protective lining, it is very difficult to remove the parts around the joints between the screen and the keyboard - I actually ended up damaging one of the joints. Engineering fail.

Reviews.Title: It's ok. Underwhelming
Reviews.Author: Lindsay
Reviews.Content: It's pretty slow. Freezes a lot. Wish I bought somethin else. Have had good experience with Asus in the past. This one kinda sucks tho.

Reviews.Title: it is sleek and fast for a small laptop!
Reviews.Author: QC
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th mini laptop I ever bought over the past three years.  Even though the two of Acers did not work for me that I had to return, the HP and ASUS are actually very good.  I like ASUS better as it is faster than my old HP.  The only thing I feel that is currently missing is the office starter.  Also it is getting a little bit hot on the bottom quick.  If ASUS can help me with that, that will be great.Regards,A new customer!

Reviews.Title: Great little laptop!
Reviews.Author: Heather Smith
Reviews.Content: Just wanted a small little laptop for using the internet. Its a great little computer. Compact, fast, and a great value. Asus doesn't dissappoint.

Reviews.Title: A good deal, but last generation's shape & size.
Reviews.Author: RST10
Reviews.Content: This is a great deal for a netbook-- but be certain that a netbook is not the same thing as an ultrabook. For the savings here you got a less comfortable keyboard and a pretty big lump on the back for the battery. The photos don't do it a good service in showing the thickness of this laptop on the back half and the battery size which isn't integrated well and adds quite a sizable amount of the back.All of those drawbacks included, this is a dead simple cheap computer and it has Windows 8. You won't find a better deal on a tiny laptop than this. Just don't be surprised that isn't the svelte thing that you might think it is from the pictures.The one I received had a shiny top instead of the carbon fiber look, and I wasn't pleased with the thickness on the back side so I returned this item. That doesn't mean it's bad though, as long as you know what you're getting for the cost.

Reviews.Title: Seller/Fantistac! Windows 8/worse than s..t!
Reviews.Author: R V
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no issues with seller.Windows 8 may be just fine on a tablet, however it renders my brand new/$280 ASUS netbook nearly useless. The mouse is klunky. How so? You must wiggle the mouse to even get the page down bar to appear. Then find the "SWEET" spot, (other wise it does not respond), on the page down bar, or close window button just to initiate a function. Which you still have to click on multiple times just to get a response. I have added a start button/screen, a close window box, turned off the hot corners and that wonderful, (What the F.. is it there for!), charms bar. I have updated/or tried to update the mouse pad driver multiple times. Only got improvement, (short lived), after loading and updating external keyboard/mouse driver.I love everything about my new netbook except the operating system.I can only hope that MS vigorously makes available updates/fixes that might actually make an otherwise fantastic product useable.

Reviews.Title: To hot on your lap
Reviews.Author: Zimmerman Eva
Reviews.Content: Had a smal acer be or was very happy ,but the batterie gave out so I wanted to try anew  fast starting internet but it is impossible to have this one on your lap way to hot

Reviews.Title: Very poor manufacturer support
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: The touchpad didn't function properly and I couldn't get responsible help from the manufacturer. It might be a good product but not worth the effort to get it working!

Reviews.Title: The perfect laptop companion
Reviews.Author: aclark203
Reviews.Content: This laptop is perfect for travel. Light and portable I take it everywhere I go, literally. Very durable as well as I have dropped it a couple of times on accident and surprisingly there was no damage.Recommend to anyone looking for a great laptop that is perfect for on the go.

Reviews.Title: Quality
Reviews.Author: chenna
Reviews.Content: It is good cheap and handy laptop but I find it very slow It is slow in starting and slow in response.But it is ok for somebody who uses the computer only for answering mail or similar small tasks.the quality of construction is good.

Reviews.Title: Loses Internet connections
Reviews.Author: AmysOtis
Reviews.Content: The netbook loses the wifi internet connection after a few minutes of being logged on.  A restart sometimes helps, other times it doesn't.  All my other computers, kindles, cell phones, etc. have no problem staying connected to the internet.  The problem lies within this netbook.  Sorry I bought it.

Reviews.Title: OK stuff
Reviews.Author: havet1
Reviews.Content: Good net book for the price, however Its a bit clunky and slow, I'm not sure if its caused primarily by windows 8, all the strange ASUS software that comes installed on it, or if its just a kind of crappy processor. the touch pad sucks like all touch pads, but it has a good screen, usb 2 and 3, and hdmi. I would rate it higher but the operating system loads so slow and windows 8 is trying hard to be android or apple or whatever, I was perfectly happy with windows 7. I would recommend this to any one who uses it casually, I think it would be a bad choice for a work related netbook.

Reviews.Title: Can't load pretty much any web page
Reviews.Author: Jay Long
Reviews.Content: I have another laptop and a cell phone which are both connected to my router.  They work fine.  Everytime I load a web page, this netbook tells me either "Webpage unavailable" or "Cannot load webpage."  I bought this netbook not expecting to do anything but surf the web.  Now it sits on my coffee table while I look everything up on my phone.  If I hit reload enough times, it will eventually load the page most of the time.  Around 8 reloads usually does the trick.  Since its not powerful enough for anything besides loading the internet, its pretty much a useless brick in my living room.

Reviews.Title: Ya get what ya pay for
Reviews.Author: kevin
Reviews.Content: i use lappy as a stage comp to run trax ect.  i need a small footprint, its a b/u for a asus aspire one, Specs led me to believe this comp was at least as fast as the acer, not true, maybe its win8?  also screen bezel comes unsnapped when you open comp, cheap, flimsy design. [read title] $249.00 shipped If i get a year outa it ill be happy, at this price its a easy to replace tool.

Reviews.Title: Good laptop
Reviews.Author: Chae R Han
Reviews.Content: Nice sized laptop for use to carry around and use when on the go. It's heavy with the battery though.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product!
Reviews.Author: Joseph Caruso
Reviews.Content: This ASUS laptop was easy to use right out of the box. Fit and finish are excellent, wife is very happy with the light weight and pink color.

Reviews.Title: Exacly what i paid for!
Reviews.Author: Zach B.
Reviews.Content: This computer is great! Its exactly what i expected. The description was spot on! New right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: I didn't realize that with the smaller screen size would come an inability to change the font size, so I have trouble reading.
Reviews.Author: PBH
Reviews.Content: I will probably sell it to someone with better eyesight as soon as I can afford a new computer. It is slow to open web pages and programs. Sometimes I wait three or four minutes for Skype to come up. The first time I thought there was something wrong with the program, but it does the same thing with all of them.It's too small to use on your lap, so I have to use a lap desk with it and that elevates it to a position that isn't comfortable for my wrists to type.All in all, I thought I wanted a small computer this time around, but having purchased one, I no longer feel that way.

Reviews.Title: Very good computer for browsing internet & simple tasks
Reviews.Author: William Ying
Reviews.Content: I asked a technician to install Windows 7 on this machine. It runs great and the speed is ok. The wifi works well. For anyone with reasonable expectations of a pc, this machine is great.Since my machine does not run on windows 8 I do not know how that works but I think it should be ok also. I followed my technician's advice and downgraded to windows 7.The trackpad is not very good, so a wireless mouse is recommended.

Reviews.Title: Second notebook I've owned
Reviews.Author: berdoopeb
Reviews.Content: This notebook is worth every penny. The little guy is almost as fast as a tablet and the Windows apps are plentiful! I travel at least 6 weeks out of the year and need a notebook computer (previously an early xp acer - slow, very slow). For production, my Toshiba tablet, though handy, just doesn't get it done. And for those maligning Windows 8, they are the problem - like any software, it must be learned. Old school, (pre dos) I was producing in a day, e-mails, ms office (not included, mind you), etc.

Reviews.Title: Asus laptop
Reviews.Author: Mary Jane Novi
Reviews.Content: So far so good, I am still using my old one for work.  So, I don't use it alot.  Not crazy about the touchpad, it is awkward.  Windows 8 takes awhile to get used to.

Reviews.Title: New laptop, New to windows 8
Reviews.Author: Gabriella
Reviews.Content: I just ordered my asus mini laptop yesterday, i just got it in the mail today!!!!!!!Super fast shipping, easy install when i turned it on . I LOVE it love love love love it, the keyboard is awesome, i love the touch pad. great buy for the money i spent, especially since it came super quick, i would recommend this to anyone looking for a good little laptop for minor things and definitely if you need something light weight, i just had partial hip replacement and this will be a perfect computer to sit in bed with and relax with :)

Reviews.Title: See review for Acer above!!
Reviews.Author: Beth Lee
Reviews.Content: I don't like how small both of these laptops are...Wish I could sell them and buy a regular size laptop!!!

Reviews.Title: pretty good laptop
Reviews.Author: tkmns
Reviews.Content: I am satisfied with the laptop so far but the windows 8 sucks. I hate it everything about windows 8. It'd be nice if were able to run win7 on it.

Reviews.Title: in some ways good in others not so good. I live in Korea now so I am unsure what to do when I have an issue
Reviews.Author: Monica L Wright
Reviews.Content: It has had a couple times that it has frozen and someone I was talking to would see delayed writing or only some writing.

Reviews.Title: OK hardware. Old version of OS though.
Reviews.Author: Alex Akhtyrskiy
Reviews.Content: The system is preinstalled with Windows 8. Configuring and cleanup took very little time. However, downloading and installing all of the updates and then migration to Windows 8.1 took the rest of the day.

Reviews.Title: Love this laptop! It's perfect for all of my computer needs.
Reviews.Author: Caren
Reviews.Content: Love this laptop! It's perfect for all of my computer needs. I have had it for a couple of months and it's really been everything i was looking for.

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice for computing needs on the go. Like it tons better than my tablet or laptop when I am out and about!
Reviews.Author: TheFrey
Reviews.Content: Except for the horrible windows 8 that was installed this is great. Extremely portable,(duh) well made and very good battery life compared to my last one.I take it with me when ever I might expect downtime... doc offices, car dealerships, chauffeuring in-laws, visiting gf who gets business calls she just has to take or going places I just don't think are safe enough for my top of the line laptop.Keeps me amused and productive.
